abortion argument appears subject to fatal difficulties.
These difficulties with the classic anti-abortion argument are well known
and thought by many to be conclusive. The symmetrical difficulties with the
classic pro-choice syllogism are not as well recognized. The pro-choice syllo-
gism can be attacked by attacking its major premise: Only persons have the
right to life. This premise is subject to scope problems because the class of
persons inclu
